head.title: CARR-GOTTSTEIN SHARES SURGE ON BUYBACK REPORT

hedline.hl1: CARR-GOTTSTEIN SHARES SURGE ON BUYBACK REPORT

block.p: Shares of the Carr-Gottstein Foods Company rose 38 percent yesterday to more than $8 a share after the company said it planned to repurchase nearly half of its shares for $11 each. The company, a food and drug retailer based in Anchorage, said late on Thursday that it would buy back up to 7.5 million shares, or about 49 percent of its outstanding stock. The stock closed up $2.375, at $8.50 a share, on the New York Stock Exchange.
